title: 114_hr970
content: The "Supporting Academic Freedom through Regulatory Relief Act" may be cited as the short title. This Act provides regulatory relief. The "Supporting Academic Freedom through Regulatory Relief Act" repeals certain regulations related to State authorization in title 34, Code of Federal Regulations. The "Supporting Academic Freedom through Regulatory Relief Act" repeals regulations related to credit hours and gainful employment in title 34, Code of Federal Regulations. The Department of Education repealed regulations related to credit hours and gainful employment in 2014. The Secretary of Education is prohibited from promulgating new regulations during a specified period. The Secretary of Education is prohibited from enacting new regulations related to State authorization for higher education institutions, gainful employment, and teacher preparation programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The prohibition period starts from the enactment of this Act until a new enactment. The Secretary of Education is prohibited from regulating the definition of "credit hour" and implementing a postsecondary institution ratings system under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Secretary of Education is prohibited from regulating the definition of "credit hour" and implementing a postsecondary institution ratings system under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The performance system rates institutions of higher education. SEC. 3. THIRD-PARTY SERVICE PROVIDERS. Section 487(a)(20) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to allow institutions to pay third-party entities for services related to student recruitment, as long as certain conditions are met. The Higher Education Act of 1965 allows institutions to pay third-party entities for services beyond student recruitment, as long as student recruitment information is not shared with other entities.
